description: From Latin anomalia, from Ancient Greek ἀνωμαλία (anōmalía, “irregularity, anomaly”), from ἀνώμαλος (anṓmalos, “irregular, uneven”), negating the meaning of ὁμαλός (homalós, “even”), from ὁμός (homós, “same”).

entries.meaning: A deviation from a rule or from what is regarded as normal; an outlier.
examples: Synonyms: abnormality, deviance, deviation, exception, inconsistency, irregularity, phenomenon

entries.meaning: Something or someone that is strange or unusual.
examples: He is an anomaly among his friends in that he's the only one who's unmarried.

entries.meaning: (sciences) Any event or measurement that is out of the ordinary regardless of whether it is exceptional or not.
examples: She disregarded some of the anomalies in the experiment, putting them down to miscalculation.

entries.meaning: (quantum mechanics) A failure of a classical symmetry due to quantum corrections.
